TITLE: SSPW Answers Used for Support Desk Security Check
BODY:
The ability for the Support Desk to be able to use key random characters from a users SSPW answers in order to securely identify the user when they call the Support Desk internally.

Example:
  1. User A has an issue with any software or hardware
  2. User A calls the SupportDesk
  3. Support Person logs into SSPW portal with an administrator login
  4. Support Person asks teh user for a random character from their SSPW answer e.g. 4th character of 'What was the naem of your first pet?', then the 2nd character of 'What was your most memorable holiday destination?'
  5. If the system returns a 'Details Verified' to the Support person the user has successfully cleared the security check and is allowed to proceed with opening a new support case

TITLE: PIN Reset via SSPW
BODY:
Requirement for users to be able to change their own onesign PIN if they believe it has been compromised or they have forgotten it without contacting the helpdesk as this may be out of hours during a night shift.

Under 'Help me login' have the ability for a user to reset their own onesign PIN by answering security questions.

Reduce time and increase clinical efficiency. Reduce helpdesk costs by reducing the number of cases raised for PIN resets.
 
This has been talked about for some timel

Then when this is launched, OneSign is already profiled for the Change password screen and it changes it. BUT on the next login, the profiles Login Screen does not re-run the key stroke commands.

BODY: `We're finding that an added benefit to the Organization Groups would be the ability to control who can see or send messages to certain groups.  For example, if a group is created so that users can message the group to activate the cath lab, there are certain risks with having this group available to all end users.  If somebody accidentally sent a message to the wrong group and ended up activating the cath lab, this would be a huge issue.  Ideally, a hospital could set permission levels for a group like this that would only allow specific users to either see or send messages to the group.

TITLE: Possibility for OneSign Agent to NOT to learn user credentials if it is already been learned under same username.
BODY:
1. USER-A works on EP-1 with application APP-1.
  2. APP-1 has an OneSign profile and credentials for USER-A are learned.
  3. USER-A goes to EP-2 to help USER-B with application APP-1.
  4. OneSign Agent at EP-2 goes in learning mode & learns USER-A's credentials under USER-B on EP-2.
Can we add a check at point 4 (OR do not allow OneSign Agent to learn credentials for USER-A under USER-B) where USER-A's credentials are not been learned again under different user, say USER-B ?
ERROR: field integrity exception: unknown (CreatedByID(00580000005KZLm) is not in org.)

TITLE: Administrator Activity Repoprt >>> Should show the exact action done by the admin and not just a basic information
BODY:
We've been checking this through case number 00208399,

Basically there are 2 options to change a user policy, but for both of the the report does not show the full information:
 
  • If an admin switches a user's policy on the multiple user selection screen (Users, Computers and Domains >> Users), the report shows as "admin X assigned user policy Z to 1 user" (where X is the admin's username and Z is the user policy name) -- So here we don't know what user was modified, we just know how many users where assigned to the policy by the admin.
 
  • If an admin switches a user's policy on a specific user (within the user's profile), the report shows as "admin X modified user Y" (where X is the admin's username and Y is the affected user username) -- So we don't know what it was modified for that user, we just know that there was a modification but that could be either policy, token, status and so on.

So we needed the combination of both where the report would show that "admin X assigned user policy Z to user Y (where X is the admin's username, Z is the policy name and Y is the affected user username).

I think people would really benefit from this enhancement specially for Audit requests and investigations.
ERROR: field integrity exception: unknown (CreatedByID(005800000074XYC) is not in org.)

In the administrator role editor (5.0 and prior), I have not found the option to delegate proximity card unenrollment for a sub-administrator.

TITLE: Improve the logon times for offline Agents
BODY:
When loggin on to a device with a type 1 agent, if no appliance is available we have seen a delay in the logon of some seconds (about 5-7 seconds in a site with two appliances), depending on the enterprise configuration and on how many appliances the agent tries to conenct to.

After this time, the agents times out and starts in offline mode.

This scenario is quite frequent for laptop users who are not always connected to the corporate network and so they're often unable to communicate with the Imprivata appliances.

Is it possible to improve this process in order to speed up the logon times when the agent is offline hence save times for the users?

TITLE: Fingerprint Driver Enhancement
BODY:
By default, the driver for fingerprint reader upek model tcrf1c by default enables "Allow the computer to turn off this device to save power."
This is a known problem as the fingerprint reader often will not wake up after turned off and Imprivata support has already advised their customers to manually turn this feature off.
 In addition, this needs to be repeated anytime the reader is moved to a different usb port.
Turning off power management changes the regkey:
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Enum\USB\VID_147E&PID_3001\anysubkey\Device Parameters]
"SelectiveSuspendEnable"=dword:00000000
Please have DigitalPersona modify tcusb.inf re-sign the driver package with the following section:


[TcUsb.Device.AddReg]
HKR,,"SelectiveSuspendEnable",0x00010001,0x0000

TITLE: Enable "Validate stored domain credentials before authenticating" automatically when SSL is used to communicate with the directory
BODY:
In the drectiry options, when SSL is enabled, OneSogn allows a user authenticating with a different modality than password to be asked to provide a new password in case this is required by the domain policy, and if the password has expired.

This feature is enabled by selecting the option "Validate stored domain credentials before authenticating" in the directory configuration page.

We have seen loads of cases where the Imprivata administrators, not aware of this option, have had their users authenticating with proximity cars and fingerprints locking their domain accounts, as once the password is expired, if they try to authenticate with a card or a finger they are not asked to input a new password, failing the authentication and after a ceratin number of failures locking their accounts.

We have published a KB article but it's still easy to predict this issue will happen again and again in the future.

If there are no downsides in enabling this option by default when enabling SSH to communicate with the directory, can we enable this option automatically when the user enables SSH?

Thsi will make the way we communicate with the directory more consistent and robust, eliminating a potential source for authentication errors, user lock-outs and downtime.

BODY:
These are needed for certain scenarios for organizations that have very tight security controls (i.e. Government agencies).

2. Provide the ability to hide/remove the option to Un-enroll a fingerprint in the Manage fingerprints functionality

3. Allow fingerprint enrollment and authentication right off the bat, without requiring password authentication at all, OR have an option where the user is switched to fingerprint authentication only and disable password authentication as soon as fingerprint is enrolled

TITLE: Custom Credential Variables
BODY:
The canned credential options that OneSign can store as variables works for most needs.  However, there have been a couple of applications for which I wanted to capture/proxy various other information.
For instance, a users First Name, email address, etc.  OneSign already knows that information for the users, but I can't call it with a variable within an app Profile.  Also, there may be other data elements that OneSign might not know and are going to be learned as unique data elements for that set of credentials.

Right now I get around this by using the 'Password 2' and 'Password 3' credential variables.  But it would be nice to actually define custom data elements for what they are used for.  That is, I could capture the user's email address and call it using a variable that I named {email} instead of simply storing it in the Password 2 credentail location.

Please use an Albany Medical Center badge."

TITLE: Display the User name of the person who has the desktop locked on shared kiosks
BODY:
If user locks desktop to walk away from device on a shared kiosk, and another user walks up to the computer, that 2nd user doesn't know that User #1 is using it and potentially has unsaved work open. 

If the OneSign screen displayed a 1st user's name it would at least be an indication the computer is in use and the 2nd person can decide to "tap over" the 1st user or look for a free device.  

OneSign knows who the current user that locked the desktop so it would be easy enought to grab this data.

TITLE: Allow for reporting on Proximity Card #'s
BODY:
We would like the ability to report on the current Proximity Card #'s by user.  As well as the past card #'s enrolled by that users.

This assists in troubleshooting and also assists in identifying security risks.

Ideally we would be able to run a report on a use and see all of the cards they have registered and when they were registered as well as run a report on a card # and see which user/s have enrolled it in the past.

TITLE: Ability to configure SSO on Computer Policy
BODY:
Since we are testing the VDA feature within Onesign there is one thing that must be disabled for the feature to work fine. If there is a SSO for the Citrix Receiver on the end-point (looking at PNAgent.exe) this one must be disabled for the user.
Is this SSO is NOT disabled, the session of the previous user would still be visible when changing users. So that is a huge safety risk.
But since you can configure SSO's only on user side it would not be easily possible for users to switch between regular configured type 2 workstations and type 2 workstations with VDA enabled.
So it would be very nice to have SSO's assigned on Computer Policy. May be on the "Override user policy" tab would be an nice place to enable/disable SSO's.

TITLE: improving reporting capabilities
BODY:
Dear Sirs,

I would like to ask you if the reporting capability of appliances can be improved. As you know, Imprivata reporting concept is more similar to a log than a real report. We have long list of operations, but it’s not possible to have charts, graphics or something like that.
So I want to ask you:

1) Is it possible to access reporting information via API in order to extract information and using them in a real report?
2) Have you got an extension of OneSign (other than Deployment report tool) in order to manage, schedule, profiling report and organize information graphicaly (charts, graphics….and so on)?

Thank you very much,
I hope in a prompt reply

Bye

Vincenzo

TITLE: Perception is that OneSign broke my Epic Connection
BODY:
We are a very large Epic shop and have deployed the OneSign agent to all the citrix servers that serve Epic. There are some current workflows that allow the citrix connection to break and users would supply their Windows credential to the Citrix server logon to continue working. However because OneSign modifies the credential provider on the citrix server, users who are not even enrollend in OneSign will see a OneSign prompt from the citrix server when the citrix connection has gone stale. Futhermore, OneSign has locked on the shared workstation account that created the initial connection and users do not know the password for this account to continue working. To correct the condition, users must change their workflow to not allow the citrix connection to go stale.

This results in a very negative business user experience - especially if the user is not a OneSign user to begin with.

The "Ask" is for the Epic Only Citrix install to NOT modify the credential provider on the citrix server. 

This would greatly improve the perception of the OneSign product at our Organization.

TITLE: Feature to report broken application profiles
BODY:
Hi Imprivata,

Would it be possible to add a scheduled feature that will report on when application profiles are no longer recognised, along the lines of an automated version of the 'screen recognition' feature? I realise this would probably be more for login screens, but it would still be invaluable when an application change occurs (e.g. 'Submit' button is changed to 'Sign in'),so that we can be notified before users rings in to the servicedesk.

Unfortunately, change processes cannot always cater for external (and sometimes internally) managed applications, and with the number of profiles we manage a feature like this would be invaluable.

TITLE: Force 2 Factor Authentication on machines users has not logged in yet within Grace Period
BODY:
Setup is as follows
Policy: Proximity + Password
Grace Period 9 hours.

Default behavior: Once user logs in with Proxmity and Password the user then can log in only using Proxmity Card for 9 hours on ANY OneSign computer.

I would like an option added that if the user goes to a different PC then they should be required to peform another 2 Factor Authentication, the Grace Period should not be reset (or give the option to reset).

All of the computer/users should be able to be in the same Computer or User Policy.

TITLE: Support for Dynamic Computer Policy Assignments
BODY:
Currently, computers are automatically assigned to a policy based on IP address, host name, or agent type.  The issue is this only occurs at the time of discovery and database entry. You must manually change policy assignments from this point. It would be extrememly beneficial if the policy assignment could be made dynamic or location aware. 

For instance; Computer A is inside a corporate network with an IP range of xxx.xxx.xxx.001 through xxx.xxx.xxx.254.  The computer inherits Policy 1 based on the defined range.  

Computer A exits the corporate network and resolves to a different IP so it inherits Policy 2.  This would allow a dynamic change in how the user is allowed to authenticate.  

In our scenario we want to disable advanced authentication while inside our network and enable it if the device leaves our network. 

We use NetMotion which has similar rules based on: 
Local address, WINS server address, DNS server address, or Mobility server address. 

I reccomend a similar set of mechanics to work in conjuction with the other ideas which leverage AD OU or Group membership to enahance product flexibility and adaptability.
ERROR: field integrity exception: unknown (CreatedByID(00580000005Jgyd) is not in org.)

TITLE: Add Secure the Desktop option on Hyperspace Logout to Epic Connector
BODY:
Currently in the Epic Connector when a user manually logs out of Epic or it times out you have the option to
A. Automatically log in same user
B.Do nothing (until the next Imprivata desktop login)

In a FUS environment some users think they have logged out at this point and walk away, leaving the workstation logged in. It would be great if there was a third option
C. Secure the desktop.

TITLE: lock / disable input devices during the timeout established during the Privacy Screen delay.
BODY:
I have recently begun to deploy OneSign to a few of our sites.  We profiled most of our applications to submit password each time. What we found is that … after user A taps out, and then user B taps in. If user B quickly hits the enter button they can get logged in to user A’s applications.
We have tried setting the profile to first time only. But that presents an issue when the same user taps back in, they will need to enter their PW.
We have put in the registry keys…
32 bit) 
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\SSOProvider\ISXAgent\ 

(64 bit) 
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\SSOProvider\ISXAgent\ 

PrivacyScreenExtraDelayInMilliseconds DWORD
This helps very little as users can still hit enter even though they don’t see the actual application screen.
The enhancement I’d like to see is to be able to lock / disable input devices during the timeout established during the Privacy Screen delay.

TITLE: Optional Citrix settings modification
BODY:
When the Imprivata Single Sign On service starts it checks whether Citrix is installed on the PC and if it does it attempts to copy the SSOVCD.DLL file to the Citrix installation folder and then configures Citrix to use this new DLL file.

In our case this causes another Citrix based piece of software that accesses smartcards to fail to access the smartcard.

If I remove the settings to fix our other piece of software then Imprivata restores them when the service is restarted.

Since we do not use Imprivata with Citrix we have no use for these settings and it is therefore just breaking our other piece of software for no actual gain.

I propose that modifications to Citrix by Single sign on is made optional either via a management setting or policy or can be disabled via a registry key.
COMPANY_NAME__C: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Trust
